scoring_dimensions.description: Annual freight under management, customer count, geographic reach, financial backing, ability to win large deals

scoring_guide.9-10: Top 1-2 in market, PE-backed, national+, 100M+ revenue
scoring_guide.7-8: Strong national player, 50-100M revenue range, significant backing
scoring_guide.5-6: Mid-market, regional strength, PE-backed but smaller

scoring_dimensions.description: Platform robustness, modernity, feature breadth, proprietary IP, integration depth, dev team size

scoring_guide.9-10: Best-in-class proprietary platform, innovative features, large dev team
scoring_guide.7-8: Strong proprietary or top-tier licensed platform, full feature set
scoring_guide.5-6: Adequate platform (proprietary or licensed), meets basics

scoring_dimensions.description: Website quality, SEO, content marketing, social media, thought leadership, lead gen sophistication
signals: LinkedIn follower count and post engagement

scoring_guide.9-10: Sophisticated multi-channel, strong SEO, regular thought leadership
scoring_guide.7-8: Professional site, active content, good social presence
scoring_guide.5-6: Decent site, some content, moderate social
scoring_guide.3-4: Basic site, minimal content, low social

scoring_dimensions.description: Extent of AI/ML in product or operations: predictive analytics, chatbots, intelligent automation, optimisation algorithms
signals: Explicit AI/ML features in product (chatbot, prediction, etc)
Marketing claims about AI (verified vs vaporware)
Data assets that could enable AI
AI mentioned in press or partnerships

scoring_guide.9-10: Production AI features, demonstrated ML, AI-first positioning
scoring_guide.7-8: One or more deployed AI features, credible AI roadmap
scoring_guide.5-6: Algorithmic optimisation (possibly ML), AI exploration signals
scoring_guide.3-4: Rule-based automation marketed as 'intelligent', no real ML
